entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: when was the last time that happened

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: a few weeks ago i guess i was i would been working on a book on a on a on a novel and when i was really when i was really getting into writing it and it was really working for me that was that was good that was really good i felt like i was accomplishing something and i felt really relaxed

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: cool what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it was about a guy who is searching for something it is it is it is his last day on earth and so he is going to find a person that he that he met and just was so struck by that he needs to he needs to find her and spend the last few minutes that he has on earth with her just because sort of it is sort of romantic adventure comedy kind of thing

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what made you decide to do that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well i have always i have always been a writer part of the reason i came to la was because of screenwriting so i wrote some screenplays and you know had a little success with that out here and but since since then i have kind of gotten tired of the limitations of the screenwriting and i have started to write more short stories and and longer just creative writing so i i have been meaning to write a novel but i was just waiting for the idea to to really hit me

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h how hard is that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it is not easy the the parts the parts when it is good it is really good but getting there is sometimes a real struggle i find it difficult i have a real love hate relationship with writing when i when i love it i just absolutely love it but sometimes i hate it because it is so difficult but it is worth it for the times when it is when it is good

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah i see what you mean how are you at controlling your temper

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: good i do not i do not really have a temper i it is not i mean most of my anger that i have is directed inward as opposed to outward to other people if something is really really stressful or if i am in a situation like a very intense confrontation i can lose it but i probably that is probably only happened to me three four times in my whole life i mean generally i pretty much try to it when i am upset i i get upset with myself not with other people

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: when was the last time you argued with someone and what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: last night i guess well i got in an argent about whether or not cleaning vegetables was necessary because of i forget it but it well no it was about whether you can clean vegetables after you cut them because i would already started cutting the vegetables and i thought that would be okay so it turned into this big argent and we did google searches to figure out who was right and who was wrong and i

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: laughter

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i ended up being wrong on that one but it is yeah that was it was not a blow up argent but it was a definite argent

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay what is something you feel guilty about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: a lot so much i i i was in a relationship that i really really that i really wanted to work and i ended up and it was partly due to i had not i was on i was not on the right medication and so i was going at like everything sort of spiraled out of control and i feel really guilty about the way that that ended and i mean i was not i was not mean but i was but i was getting more and more messed up and i could not stop it and it ended and so i feel really guilty about not doing enough and and not and and you know making her have to tell me that she never wanted to see me again so that was pretty that was pretty tough

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h could you have done anything to avoid it

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well some of it was was that i was not medicated properly i mean now i have been to a doctor and i am on medication that is completely kind of i mean i still get i still get upset and i still get depressed but it is not like it was it is not i do not completely lose it for days at a time so i mean i know there is a part of me that knows logically that it was not all my fault and that if i had if i had been able to deal with the chemicals in my brain then i would have then it would have probably be different if i was who i am now then i would have i would i would be i would be it probably would have gone very differently or maybe it would not have but i mean i could have i do not know i do not know if i could have done anything different

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: things being how they were

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you think that maybe you are being a little hard on yourself

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i mean it is it is possible i mean obviously yeah because i mean that is what i do i i take little things i mean i take little things and i just think about them all the time in my head until until it drives me crazy i dwell on stuff and it is like any little detail that comes up i suddenly remember and it can just throw me off for a whole day i mean i still i still get i still get really uncomfortable and embarassed and then feel ashamed about stuff that i did in high school which was years and years ago which i should not even be thinking about anymore cause it is so in the past but i still get that feeling like i am right back there

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: are they triggered by something

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: they are triggered by everything pretty much anything that i that i see if i if i if i hear somebody with a dutch last name if i if i hear somebody talk about wisconsin if i hear you know people talk about just anything you know i can reach back and connect to to this it is really it is really i do not know that is the thing i mean i do not ever get a break from it

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that sucks

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how easy is it for you to get a good night is sleep

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i do not know i am a very light sleeper so i awake and asleep and awake and asleep i have no problem going back to sleep but i generally you know do not i do not know i never really needed much sleep so it is just only recently that i have really started to to like feel the effects of not getting enough sleep like i would i would usually stay up until two or three in the morning so that i could just be so exhausted that i could just conk out and wake up the next day and feel fine go to work but now it is it is it is like if i do that i can not i still do not get enough sleep i do not conk out i still just sleep very lightly you know i get up i toss and turn all night you know and now it is just it is yeah i do not sleep too great right now

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what are you like when you do not sleep well

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: pretty i mean i do not know it is hard to it is hard to know i i usually just kind of power through it and just i am i am like how i am now just i just feel bad

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay how long ago were you diagnosed

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i think about three three four years ago it was when i i had been given taking stuff for anxiety for for years before that but then i finally got a psychiatrist who actually sat down and talked to me and said you have actually got this situation and we need to get you on the medication that you are on is not working you need to get on this new medication that will actually start to like even you out and heal you a little bit from all this so so yeah that was that was kind of a a turning point but unfortunately it happened after everything went bad so i do not know

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how did you feel in that moment

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: in the moment i do not know i do not really think i thought about it too much then but looking back on it i feel it really makes me angry it really makes me you know given where i am right now it makes me really angry that i am that i had to that i i lost everything because because of chemicals in my brain because of things that i could not control and that you know the people that were supposed to help me were not helping me i mean i was paying i was paying a lot of money to to go see doctors and they were doing and they you know it was not it was it did not help it did not work until until you know i managed to find somebody who did work and i just yeah so i am i am like thanks guys for helping but it was a little it is a little late now

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah what got you to seek help

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: there really was not any choice i had to i was i was a mess i was it was either i was i was self medicating it was affecting my work i mean it was everything was just at there was a point where i really realized that i mean i just had to like make this different but again it was too late because you know then my review came up a few months later and you know after after everything after being institutionalized once or twice and all this stuff you know they just decided that i was just not worth keeping around so they laid me off but it was at least that and not firing me but but but yeah but so i got help but it was but it was not soon enough

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay do you still go to therapy now

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: not not as much as i should i go to a couple of meetings i go to i go to aa so that i can you know keep control of that aspect too too and there is a there is a therapy aspect to that unfortunately you know being unemployed my unemployment ran out you know i am i am you know i am getting my medication from the city of la so you know i am not really in a position to put money into seeing somebody so i have a psychiatrist that i go see but it is really very i have i have only seen her three times in the past year so it is basically to keep my medication coming

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what sort of changes have you noticed since you have been going to therapy

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well like i said i mean just the talk i mean the the let is just take the aa for example because that is probably the closest closest for that i am seeing with therapy for now just saying stuff outloud is just like getting getting this stuff out trying to figure out how to take that mess that is in your stomach and in your brain and make it into words and sentences that make sense that you can actually deal with is a big step like regardless of who you are saying it to whether it is a therapist or just a room full of of drunks you know i mean you are you are taking all that stuff that is that is really been killing you and you are making it into something you can deal with something that you can write down something that you can talk about as opposed to just letting it just sit there as this formless thing

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: right

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how have you been feeling lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: you know better than i than i have been i mean it it sort of it goes it has its ups and downs you know i am applying for jobs five six jobs or more a a day you know and never getting a response never getting an interview never even getting close to to to being self sufficient again it is hard but that is like real world problems i feel like the chemical parts are getting under control like the the depression is getting under control so now it is just i have to deal with real life which is it just has its it is just its own own challenge

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah it can be tough to find a good job these days

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about the last time you felt really happy

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it was probably you know a couple years ago i i was i mean the thing that iediately comes to mind is everything was going well at my job i was making these great videos with with this person that i that iwas having a relationship with and we were really close we were having fun together and we went out and got a christmas tree and we spent the all this time picking out the perfect christmas tree and it was just feeling like a part of somebody is life and feeling like a part of the bigger the bigger life that is that is out there you know like what normal people feel you know for that instant i felt like a normal person doing a normal thing with a pretty girl who he really really liked a lot and you know everything was going really well and i mean it was not going really well because it was all messed up but for that instant i felt like a normal person a normal happy person and part of what makes it so hard now is knowing that i do not know if i will ever feel that again so
